e4: Switching to the new policy enhances corporate integrity by reporting true earnings without bias, fostering long-term trust with investors. Although it may initially confuse investors accustomed to the old adjustment, clear communication can alleviate these concerns. The change minimizes legal risks and aligns better with ethical business practices, promoting transparency and building investor confidence.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should ensure transparency, accuracy, and honesty in financial disclosures, allowing investors to make informed decisions without manipulation or hidden biases. Such a policy should comply with legal standards, protect all types of investors equally, and support the firm's long-term integrity. Clear, proactive communication during transitions can mitigate confusion and uphold trust.
e6: What specific strategies do you plan to communicate the change in reporting policy to all investors effectively? How will you support retail investors during this transition to prevent disadvantage against more sophisticated investors? What legal or regulatory implications have been considered in changing the policy to ensure compliance? How will this change impact upcoming financial projections and investor relations?
